html:
Manasseh/Ephraim. The Jerusalem Bible reads "Manasseh devours Ephraim, Ephraim [devours] Manasseh," meaning that tribes, families, and even brothers will contend against one another during these times of trouble. Earlier, Isaiah says that "no man shall spare his brother" (9:19) and "they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm" (9:20).

they together shall be against Judah. Manasseh and Ephraim will strive against one another as well as against Judah.
